data.title: Schismatrix by Bruce Sterling
data.meta_description: Schismatrix. Roman. by Sterling, Bruce and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Paperback. Condition: Used; Very Good. ***Simply Brit*** Welcome to our online used book store, where affordability meets great quality. Dive into a world of captivating reads without breaking the bank. We take pride in offering a wide selection of used books, from classics to hidden gems, ensuring there is something for every literary palate. All orders are shipped within 24 hours and our lightning fast-delivery within 48 hours coupled with our prompt customer service ensures a smooth journey from ordering to delivery. Discover the joy of reading with us, your trusted source for affordable books that do not compromise on quality.

Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.

Softcover. Condition: Near Fine. First Edition; First Printing. Near Fine first edition (complete number line) showing slight crease to lower front cover tip and some age discoloration to the page block). 319 pages, unmarked; OOCB X1X; 9.0 X 5.8 X 0.9 inches; 319 pages.

Condition: Very Good. Book is in Used-VeryGood condition. Pages and cover are clean and intact. Used items may not include supplementary materials such as CDs or access codes. May show signs of minor shelf wear and contain very limited notes and highlighting. 1.2.

Octavo, boards. First edition. The first significant popularization of post-humanism in SF. "The climax of his 'Shaper/Mechanist' cycle of stories . "This remarkably inventive book is an exploration of various 'post-human' cultures living, by no means harmoniously, in artificial space habitats. Few recent writers of SF have treated the future evolution of the human race in such serious and stimulating terms. Sterling's best novel." - Pringle, The Ultimate Guide to Science Fiction, second edition (1995), p. 314. 1985 Nebula award nominee. Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-1083. Sargent, British and American Utopian Literature, 1516-1985, p. 432. A fine copy in fine dust jacket. (#106152).

Octavo, cream wrappers printed in black. Advance copy (uncorrected proof) of the first edition. Signed by Sterling on the title page. The first significant popularization of post-humanism in SF. "The climax of his 'Shaper/Mechanist' cycle of stories . "This remarkably inventive book is an exploration of various 'post-human' cultures living, by no means harmoniously, in artificial space habitats. Few recent writers of SF have treated the future evolution of the human race in such serious and stimulating terms. Sterling's best novel." - Pringle, The Ultimate Guide to Science Fiction, second edition (1995), p. 314. 1985 Nebula award nominee. Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-1083. Sargent, British and American Utopian Literature, 1516-1985, p. 432. Publisher's publicity sheet laid in. A bit of mild foxing to cover, a nearly fine copy. (#158688).

Hardcover. First Edition; First Printing. Fine book, signed by the author on the title page, in fine, but for one small, barely noticeable, snag on front cover. ; 8vo 8" - 9" tall; 288 pp.
